description: A passionate and innovative chef with many years of experience in French and Italian cuisine. Skilled in menu planning, food preparation, and kitchen management. Has a reputation for creating unique and flavorful dishes using seasonal and locally-sourced ingredients.

cooking_method: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, carrots, and celery, and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and cloves. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the lentils, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and simmer until the lentils are tender, about 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bread crumbs, milk, Parmesan cheese, parsley, garlic, egg, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Form the mixture into 2-inch meatballs.
Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, and red pepper flakes. Bring to a simmer.
Add the meatballs to the sauce and simmer until cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti according to the package directions.
Serve the spaghetti topped with the meatballs and sauce, and grated Parmesan cheese.
